Class MyMathMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • MyMathMethods

  • public class MyMathMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    Some Personal interesting math functions all methods are static
    Version:
    1.0 Build Mar 28, 2014.
    Author:
    Yuriy Miedviediev

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static float computeFunc(int x, int a)
      Task 6
      computes a special function y=log2(x-4)+exp(2a-x) range of permissible values: x greater than 4 (log functions can be taken only from nonnegative values)
      static int countDigits(int number)
      Task 1
      returns the number of digits of the input
      static int factRecur(int n)
      Task 4
      returns factorial of the given number using recursion assumes given number is nonnegative
      static int fibRecur(int n)
      Task 5
      returns fibonacci number of the given input using recursion assumes given number is nonnegative
      static void makePermut(int n)
      Task 7
      prints all permutations of numbers 1..n n! possible combinations Caution! Don't use numbers greater than 5 unless you need a really big sequence of combinations
      static float powRecur(int base, int power)
      Task 3
      returns number raised to the given power using recursion
      static int reverseNumber(int number)
      Task 2
      returns reversed version of the input

      • computeFunc

        public static float computeFunc(int x,
                                int a)
        Task 6
        computes a special function y=log2(x-4)+exp(2a-x) range of permissible values: x greater than 4 (log functions can be taken only from nonnegative values)
        Parameters:
        x - natural integer greater than 4
        a - negative or natural integer or zero
        Returns:
        float point number, y function of the given x

      • makePermut

        public static void makePermut(int n)
        Task 7
        prints all permutations of numbers 1..n n! possible combinations Caution! Don't use numbers greater than 5 unless you need a really big sequence of combinations
        Parameters:
        n - nonnegative integer
